thread.title: About that ASU ad during the Super Bowl
thread.title_full: About that ASU ad during the Super Bowl

author: Kaila White
title: About that ASU ad during the Super Bowl
text:
About that ASU ad during the Super Bowl Kaila White , The Republic | azcentral.com 5:03 p.m. MT Feb. 6, 2017 CLOSE Share Advertiser Video: Learn to Thrive The ad featured Arizona State University student Mark Huerta, who is CEO of a non-profit that helps communities in underdeveloped countries gain access to clean drinking water. According to Arizona State University, the ad only ran locally on Fox 10 and the cost of the ad time charged the university was $75,000. (Photo: Michael Chow/The Republic) 
Many Arizonans were surprised to see Arizona State University's advertisement during the Super Bowl, a well-produced story about one student who is helping to solve the global clean-water crisis. 
The ad featured ASU engineering and education doctoral student Mark Huerta. He is co-founder and CEO of the non-profit 33 Buckets , which helps communities in underdeveloped countries gain access to clean drinking water. 
"To see those kids drink clean water for the first time, it’s the most rewarding feeling you can ever have," Huerta said in the ad. "I went to ASU because I wanted to change the world. The thing I never would have expected was how the world would have changed me." 
It only ran locally on Fox 10, according to ASU, and the cost of the ad time charged the university was $75,000. 
"As we look for innovative ways to share what’s going on at ASU, we are mindful of budgets and act as efficiently as we can. The ability to reach a Super Bowl-sized audience here in the Phoenix area at a heavily-discounted price was an example of ASU using resources carefully and to the maximum effect," the university said in a statement. More about 33 Buckets
